title-group.article-title: "Rigidization-on-Command"™ (ROC) Resin Development for Lightweight Isogrid Booms with MLI

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2004 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: The "Rigidization-on-Command"™ (ROCTM™) resin development has focused on the development of resin systems that use UV light cure for rigidization. Polymeric sensitizers have been incorporated into the resin formulations to promote cure using Pen-Ray lamps and UV light-emitting diodes (LED's). Formulations containing the polymeric sensitizers were examined by FTIR and DSC. Complete cure was observed after 15 min. exposure with the Pen-Ray lamps. Performance of the Pen-Ray lamps and UV LEDs was thoroughly characterized. Thermal models were developed to optimize the performance of the of the MLI insulation thermal oven used for orbital cure of the boom. Results show that -12°C is the lowest temperature required for cure of the ROC™ resin systems.

ref.mixed-citation: R.E. Allred, L.A. Harrah, A.E. Hoyt, P.M. McElroy, R.A. Wise, and M.C. Lou, "Inflatable Spacecraft Using Rigidization on Command (ROC) Concept," 41st AIAA/ASME/ASCE/AHS/ASC SDM Conference, April 3-6, 2000, Atlanta, GA, Paper AIAA 2000-1637.

P.M. McElroy, R.A. Wise, R.E. Allred, L.A. Harrah, and A.E. Hoyt, "Orbital Thermal Analyses of "Rigidization-on-Command" (ROC) Materials for Inflatable Spacecraft", Paper, 30th Conference on Environmental Systems (ICES), July 2001, Orlando, FL, Paper 2001-01-2220.

R. E. Allred, A. E. Hoyt, P. M. McElroy, S. Scarborough, D. P. Cadogan, "UV Rigidlzed Carbon- Reinforced Isogrld Boom for Gossamer Applications," Proc. Space Technology and Applications Int'l Forum- STAIF 2002, Albuquerque, NM, Feb. 3-6, 2002, pp. 406-413.

R. E. Allred, A. E. Hoyt, P. M. McElroy, S. Scarborough, D. P. Cadogan, "UV Rigidizable Carbon- Reinforced Isogrid Inflatable Booms," Proc. 43rd AIAA/ASME/ASCE/AHS/ASC Structures, Structural Dynamics, and Materials Conf., April 22-25, 2002, Denver, CO, paper 2002-1202.
